original: Landgren, Alrik Vitalis, fil. mag., Torsås, f. 18/11/87 i Blentarp, Mal-möh. 1., av folkskoll. Bengt L. o. Kri- stina Nilsson. G. 1. 22 m. Martha Wirth; 2. 40 m. ämneslär. Greta Ohlsson. Barn: Elly f. 23, Nadja Maria 31, Bengt 42. — Mog:ex. i Lund 05, fil. kand. i Upps. 14, fil. mag. i Lund 31, provår 34. Resor t. Tyskl. 21-22, 22-23, 3il, som färdledare vid svensktyska skolungdomsutbytet 32, 35, 36, 38 och 39, Engl. med stip. 37. Lär. v. Marianne unds praktiska skola 19-20, Katrineholms tekn. sk. 21-22, e. o. lär. i Katrineholm 22-24, Vetlanda 24-25, 26-33, v. Gbgs västra real 25-26, e. lär. i Jönköp. 34-35, ord. ämneslär. i Torsås 35, adj. där 47. Skr.: Lärob. i prakt. räkn.
translated:
Landgren, Alrik Vitalis, MA, Torsås, born on November 18, 1887 in Blentarp, Malmöhus County, the eldest son of elementary school teacher Bengt L. and Kristina Nilsson. He was married twice, first in 1922 to Martha Wirth and secondly in 1940 to subject teacher Greta Ohlsson. He had three children: Elly, born in 1923, Nadja Maria, born in 1931, and Bengt, born in 1942. 

Landgren completed his teaching degree in Lund in 1905, his Bachelor's degree in Uppsala in 1914, and his Master's degree in Lund in 1931. He also spent time abroad, traveling to Germany in 1921-1922, 1922-1923, and 1931 as a tour guide for the Swedish-German school youth exchange program. He also received a scholarship to study in England in 1937.

He worked as a teacher at Marianne's Practical School from 1919 to 1920, Katrineholm Technical School from 1921 to 1922, and as a substitute teacher in Katrineholm from 1922 to 1924, and Vetlanda from 1924 to 1925, and 1926 to 1933. He taught at Gothenburg's Western Real School from 1925 to 1926 and as a permanent teacher in Jönköping from 1934 to 1935. In 1935, he became a regular subject teacher in Torsås and later became the deputy there in 1947.

Landgren's written work includes a textbook on practical mathematics.
